question_text: What is the length of the segment of the number line whose endpoints satisfy $|x-\sqrt[5]{16}|=3$?
response:
The absolute value equation can be written as two separate equations:

$$x - \sqrt[5]{16} = 3\quad \text{and}\quad x - \sqrt[5]{16}=-3.$$

Solving for x, we get:
 
$$x=3+\sqrt[5]{16}\qquad \text{and}\qquad x=-3 + \sqrt[5]{16}.$$ 

The difference between these endpoints is the length of the segment.  Subtracting the two values gives us:

\begin{align*}
(3+\sqrt[5]{16})-(-3+\sqrt[5]{16})
&=6
\end{align*}

So, the answer to our problem is $\boxed{6}.$
